page.title: 09Avenue Memories by Mrs.Ward
page.content: During the past few years I have walked along The Avenue on many occasions but my memories go back beyond that.My earliest memories are of a stretch of highway flanked by tall,majestic Elms which met overhead.It was like going through a dark,green tunnel and then emerging into brightness.The trees were planted between 1803 and 1805 and were well known as a picturesque beauty spot and attracted many tourists.In 1978 disaster struck.The trees had to be felled because they were in a dangerous condition due to Dutch Elm disease.The resulting bareness was what struck one the most.Many residents thought the landscape would never be the same again.Replacement trees were planted and the Women's Institute planted daffodils which flower each spring.
